meta.title: MessageDrop - Explore Places & News

meta.ogDescription: Your gateway to social stories, places, and updates.

pin.hintBody: To use MessageDrop, I have to choose a PIN. I can't forget it, since there's no way to recover it. The PIN is encrypted, hashed, and stored only on my device.

restore.deleteUserFailed: Unable to delete the current user.
restore.imageRestoreUnsupported: Image restore is not supported in this browser.

serverDown.title: Oops! Our server went on a coffee break...
serverDown.message:
Apparently, our backend needed some "me time".

Don't worry, we sent a carrier pigeon to bring it back.

backupExit.title: Create backup before leaving?
backupExit.message: You have unsaved changes. Do you want to create a backup now?

auth.accountCreated: Your account has been created. You can log in now.
auth.userCreationFailed: Oops! Something went wrong while creating your user. Please try again later.
auth.sessionExpiredMessage: Your session has expired for security reasons. Please log in again to continue.
auth.createUserTitle: Want to create a user? It's that easy.
auth.createUserMessage:
Just choose a PIN - no username and no password required.

Please keep this PIN safe. We do not store it, cannot reset it, and cannot recover it for you.

If the PIN is lost, access to this user is permanently lost as well.

You can delete your user at any time in the app.

If the user is not used for 90 days, it will be automatically and permanently deleted, including all associated data.
auth.pinIncorrect: PIN is not correct. Please try again.
auth.userNotFoundMessage:
Looks like this user has been inactive for a while.

To keep things clean and simple, users are automatically deleted after 90 days of inactivity.

You can create a new one anytime - no signup, no hassle.
auth.backendErrorMessage: Something went wrong. Please try again later.

report.title: Report content

intro.start: Reporting should be simple. You can submit a
intro.end: (notice under the EU Digital Services Act).
intro.emphasis: None of the fields are required
intro.tail: We will review the post either way.

fields.reasonPlaceholderQuick: Share any details that help us understand the issue...
fields.reasonPlaceholderFormal: Describe the issue and provide any relevant facts or references...
fields.emailHintProvided: We will notify you at {{ email }}
fields.emailHintMissing: We can only notify you if you provide an email.
fields.emailInvalid: Please enter a valid email address or leave this field empty.
fields.truthAffirmation: I declare that the information provided is accurate to the best of my knowledge. (optional)

evidence.linkHint: http(s)://example.com â€¢ Press Enter to add
evidence.hint: PDF or image files, up to 5 MB each (10 MB total). Currently selected files: {{ size }}.

report.successSignalMessage: Thanks! Your quick report was submitted successfully. Our team will review it.
report.successNoticeMessageWithEmail: Your DSA notice was submitted successfully. We will contact you via email after the review.
report.successNoticeMessageNoEmail: Your DSA notice was submitted successfully. If you would like to receive updates, please provide an email address next time.

status.title: Report sent successfully
status.secondarySignal: Keep the link below to follow up on the review progress at any time.
status.secondaryNoticeEmail: We will also try to reach out via email when the review is complete. You can check the latest status using this link.
status.secondaryNotice: If you want to keep track of the review, save this link. You can come back to it whenever you need the latest status.
status.copyFailed: Could not copy the link automatically. Please copy it manually.

case.title: Moderation status
case.loadLatestFailed: We could not load the latest information.
case.loadNotFound: No case information was found for this token.
case.loadFailed: Could not load the current status. Please try again later.
case.appealHint: You can provide additional context and optional contact details. Supporting documents help us review faster.

appealForm.error: Please describe why you believe this decision should be reviewed.
appealForm.fileHint: PDF or image files, up to 5 MB each (10 MB total). Currently selected files: {{ size }}.

case.filesTypeLimit: Only PDF or image files are allowed.
case.filesSizeLimit: Each file must be at most 5 MB.
case.filesTotalLimit: Files exceed the total limit of 10 MB.
case.appealSubmittedPartial: Appeal submitted but some files failed to upload.
case.appealDecisionPending: A decision has not been finalized yet. Appeals are only possible afterwards.
case.appealSubmitFailed: Could not submit the appeal. Please try again later.

pm10.low: Low PM10 level. Air quality is good.
pm10.high: High PM10 level. Consider limiting outdoor activity.

pm2_5.low: Low PM2.5 level. Air is clean.
pm2_5.veryHigh: Very high PM2.5. Unhealthy air quality.

pollutants.carbonMonoxide: Carbon monoxide (CO) - a colorless, odorless gas harmful in high concentrations.
pollutants.nitrogenDioxide: Nitrogen dioxide (NO2) - a pollutant from traffic and combustion.
pollutants.sulphurDioxide: Sulphur dioxide (SO2) - can irritate airways and affect lung function.
pollutants.ozone: Ozone (O3) - high levels can lead to respiratory problems.

tooltips.alderPollen: Alder pollen can cause allergic reactions like sneezing or itchy eyes.
tooltips.birchPollen: Birch pollen is a common allergen, especially in spring.
tooltips.grassPollen: Grass pollen is a major cause of hay fever during the summer months.
tooltips.mugwortPollen: Mugwort pollen is active late summer and may trigger asthma.
tooltips.olivePollen: Olive pollen is common in Mediterranean areas.
tooltips.ragweedPollen: Ragweed pollen is highly allergenic and spreads easily.
tooltips.pm10: PM10 refers to coarse particles that can enter the lungs and cause respiratory issues.
tooltips.pm2_5: PM2.5 are fine particles that penetrate deep into the lungs and bloodstream.
tooltips.carbonMonoxide: CO is a toxic gas that can impair oxygen transport in the body.
tooltips.nitrogenDioxide: NO2 is produced by traffic emissions and affects lung function.
tooltips.sulphurDioxide: SO2 can cause respiratory symptoms and aggravate asthma.
tooltips.ozone: O3 is a reactive gas that can cause airway inflammation and breathing issues.
